blocks.value: The Virtues are the fifth choir of angels. They are known as the "brilliant" or "shining ones" and are primarily associated with miracles, blessings, and the bestowal of grace. The Virtues inspire people to strengthen their faith and trust in God.

The Virtues govern nature and the movement of the heavenly bodies. They are involved in the physical world, ensuring that nature follows its divinely ordained course. More importantly, they bestow grace and valor to the saints, especially martyrs, and work miracles to strengthen faith.

When Jesus ascended into Heaven, it is believed that the Virtues were present to escort Him (Ephesians 1:20-21). The Virtues teach us courage, fortitude, and the importance of cooperating with God's grace in our lives. They encourage us to trust in God's providence and to remain steadfast in faith, especially during trials.
